html: 4.25.19  1:18 pm   hey man, thank you so much for making at the airport terminal. i have a family member who travels constantly and it really complicates our relationship, and my life has been taking a really jagged path these days and it's hard to feel like there's a purpose or give myself permission to be quietly satisfied with the process when i'm yanking myself all over the place by my own chain. at the airport terminal scratches both those itches for me, so to speak. i've been watching/listening to it a lot this week and it's really been nice. <3

html:
4.25.19  11:09 am   4.23.19  9:55 pm how can i develop such a bold level of confidence in a "product"?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201904232155

4.23.19  9:55 pm   How do you handle the notion of consumer expectation when doing something as personal as music? Or do you not handle it?

     i was able to spend an obscene amount of time developing the product outside the realm of any consumer on earth. i was so confident in where i was going that i knew it would be the right product, especially for the right consumer(s). then when the consumer(s) arrived i was already well accustomed to the strategy and there was certainly no need to change it. but i do find that i need some shades or blinds occasionally, just so i can see what i'm doing a little more clearly
original_html: 4.25.19  11:09 am   4.23.19  9:55 pm how can i develop such a bold level of confidence in a "product"?
